item.title: second
item.description:
table example

pwd # print repertoire actuel
cd .. # remonte au repertoire parent
cd / # aller a la racine
echo "# exemple de l'arborescence de la racine sous Mac"
ls # exemple de l'arborescence de la racine sous Mac
cd ~ # aller a home
echo "# sortie de la commande cat"
echo "Bonjour" > test.txt
cat test.txt # visualiser le contenu d'un fichier
echo "# montrer les metadonnes du contenu"
wc test.txt # la commande egale wc -mlw, m = caractere l = ligne, w = mots

/Users/rosingle/Documents/siteProjetEncadre/content/frontend
# exemple de l'arborescence de la racine sous Mac
Applications
Library
System
Users
Volumes
bin
cores
dev
etc
home
opt
private
sbin
tmp
usr
var
# sortie de la commande cat
Bonjour
# montrer les metadonnes du contenu
       1       1       8 test.txt
Syntax Description
Header Title
Paragraph Text

R

You can embed an R code chunk like this:

summary(cars)

     speed           dist       
 Min.   : 4.0   Min.   :  2.00  
 1st Qu.:12.0   1st Qu.: 26.00  
 Median :15.0   Median : 36.00  
 Mean   :15.4   Mean   : 42.98  
 3rd Qu.:19.0   3rd Qu.: 56.00  
 Max.   :25.0   Max.   :120.00  

fit <- lm(dist ~ speed, data = cars)
fit


Call:
lm(formula = dist ~ speed, data = cars)

Coefficients:
(Intercept)        speed  
    -17.579        3.932  

par(mar = c(0, 1, 0, 1))
pie(
  c(280, 60, 20),
  c('Sky', 'Sunny side of pyramid', 'Shady side of pyramid'),
  col = c('#0292D8', '#F7EA39', '#C4B632'),
  init.angle = -50, border = NA
)

Figure 1: A fancy pie chart.

item.title: 1 article
item.description:
table example

pwd # print repertoire actuel
cd .. # remonte au repertoire parent
cd / # aller a la racine
echo "# exemple de l'arborescence de la racine sous Mac"

cd ~ # aller a home
echo "# sortie de la commande cat"
echo "Bonjour" > test.txt
cat test.txt # visualiser le contenu d'un fichier
echo "# montrer les metadonnes du contenu"
wc test.txt # la commande egale wc -mlw, m = caractere l = ligne, w = mots

R

You can embed an R code chunk like this:

summary(cars)

     speed           dist       
 Min.   : 4.0   Min.   :  2.00  
 1st Qu.:12.0   1st Qu.: 26.00  
 Median :15.0   Median : 36.00  
 Mean   :15.4   Mean   : 42.98  
 3rd Qu.:19.0   3rd Qu.: 56.00  
 Max.   :25.0   Max.   :120.00  

fit <- lm(dist ~ speed, data = cars)
fit


Call:
lm(formula = dist ~ speed, data = cars)

Coefficients:
(Intercept)        speed  
    -17.579        3.932  

par(mar = c(0, 1, 0, 1))
pie(
  c(280, 60, 20),
  c('Sky', 'Sunny side of pyramid', 'Shady side of pyramid'),
